NewsArticle.TeaserText: Liam Rosenior was proud of how his players adapted to a first-half tactical change which helped inspire a 2-0 victory over West Bromwich Albion.
NewsArticle.Title: Rosenior’s West Brom Reaction
NewsArticle.BodyText:
Benjamin Tetteh’s thumping first-half finish and Dara O’Shea’s second-half own goal earned a third win in four home matches and extended our unbeaten run at the MKM Stadium to seven.

“I’m proud of the players,” said Rosenior.

“I think we’ve played against the second-best team in the league when you analyse them since Carlos (Corberán) has come in at West Brom.

“They’ve got outstanding players for the level and we had a difficult first period – they completely dominated us.

“We had to change the pressing shape and that’s why I’ve got to give the players so much credit.

“You have to see periods out and we did that. We changed the shape, pressed a bit higher and once we did that, we looked a really good, organised, structured team.”

Tetteh’s ferocious left-footed strike was the Ghanaian’s first goal for the Tigers and Rosenior enthused: “It was a cracker! A left footer in the far stanch.

“He’s capable of it. He’s done it in training so for him to bring it out on the big stage, I’m delighted with him and he kept working for the team.

“I took him on 65 minutes because he got a stamp on his foot – hopefully, it’s not too bad.”

The forward was visibly emotional after opening his City account, with the boss explaining: “He’s had an emotional few weeks. A lot of the players have been affected by the awful disaster in Türkiye.

“One of Benji’s best friends was Christian Atsu (who tragically passed away in the earthquake) and he’s been down so I’m sure he’ll dedicate that goal to him.”
